title:
Sentinel-1 SAR Based Weakly Supervised Learning For Tropical Forest
  Mapping
abstract:
Tropical forests play an important role in regulating the global carbon cycle
and are crucial for maintaining the tropical forest biodiversity. Therefore,
there is an urgent need to map the extent of tropical forest ecosystems.
Recently, deep learning has come out as a powerful tool to map these ecosystems
with the caveat of curating high quality reference datasets. Since, manually
annotating high quality reference datasets is time consuming and expensive,
weakly supervised learning techniques offer the potential to train high quality
models without the need for manually annotating large quantities of reference
datasets. In this manuscript, we propose two weakly supervised approaches that
are based on Sentinel-1 SAR images, sparsely distributed pixel-wise high
quality reference labels and densely distributed noisy reference labels. The
proposed approaches were tested in a tropical setting in the Brazilian amazon.
The results demonstrate that high quality tropical forest maps can be derived
from weakly supervised learning without the need for manually annotated labels.
